transportAdvice: San Remo's historic center and seafront promenade are very walkable, making it easy to reach most tourist attractions on foot. Local buses connect the town and surrounding areas, and taxis are readily available for longer journeys or trips to nearby coastal towns.

weather.description: Cool and mild by Italian Riviera standards, with occasional rain showers but plenty of crisp, sunny days.
Still cool but the famous San Remo flower festival brings color; expect mild temperatures and some rain.
Spring begins to emerge with warming temperatures and blooming vegetation along the coast.
Pleasant and increasingly warm, with occasional showers and lush green hillsides.
Warm and largely sunny, ideal for early beach visits and outdoor dining along the promenade.
Hot and sunny with long days, marking the start of the busy beach season.
Peak summer heat with abundant sunshine and very little rain; beaches are at their liveliest.
Hot and humid with crowded beaches; the busiest tourist month on the Italian Riviera.
Warm and pleasant with thinning crowds, making it one of the best months to visit.
Mild autumn temperatures with more frequent rain; the sea remains warm enough for swimming early in the month.
Noticeably cooler and wetter, with quieter streets and a more local atmosphere.
Cool and quiet with festive decorations; mild compared to much of Europe but expect some rainy days.
